definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
to amputate one or both feet (punishment in imperial China)/see also 五刑[wu3 xing2]
to shift to an earlier date/to do sth ahead of time/in advance
to leave for/to proceed towards/to go
around/from beginning to end/all around/front and rear

sentences.english: Meditation can help, and should be your first choice before medication.
sentences.chinese: 沉思能幫助你並應該是你就醫前的首選。

sentences.english: Encourage her release by constructing an erotic fantasy before things heat up.
sentences.chinese: 應當在高潮激發前鼓勵她通過性幻想放鬆自己。

sentences.english: It starts with that deep breath of confidence you take before the first step.
sentences.chinese: 千里之行，開始於邁出第一步前那口自信的深呼吸。

sentences.english: Some years ago, a good family moved into the third floor apartment of the tenement where we lived in the Bronx.
sentences.chinese: 多年前，我們住在布朗克斯時，三樓搬來一家新租戶。

sentences.english: She ordered gummi bears and a knife a couple hours ago.
sentences.chinese: 幾小時前預定了一些小熊軟糖和一把刀。

sentences.english: This is the ancient origins of the rise of Buddhism and Taoism in the pre-existing folk activities.
sentences.chinese: 這是源流古者在佛道教興起前就有的民俗活動。

sentences.english: I ate a few minutes ago.
sentences.chinese: 吃了，我幾分鐘前吃了飯。

sentences.english: Grocery stores, for example, will have pricing power they haven't experienced in years.
sentences.chinese: 例如百貨店，就擁有幾年前沒有的價格上的優勢。

sentences.english: The team failed to capitalize on their early lead.
sentences.chinese: 這個隊未能充分利用開場時領前的優勢。

sentences.english: Before I got these, my allergies would turn into weeks-long sinus infections.
sentences.chinese: 在我開始使用前，過敏症狀已變成持續幾周的鼻炎。

sentences.english: They become too attached to the computer screen. It isn't healthy.
sentences.chinese: 他們變得太黏在計算機屏幕前，這很不健康。

sentences.english: Emerging Asia has grown by an annual average of 8% over the past three years—as fast as before the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 過去三年來以年均8%的速度增長着，和危機前一樣。

sentences.english: He had cleared them out three years ago but they had all come back in again.
sentences.chinese: 祂三年前曾經把他們趕出去，但不久又回覆舊觀。

sentences.english: The master bedroom of Room 318 had changed little since his stay 17 years earlier.
sentences.chinese: 318房的主臥室和他十七年前入住時相比變化不大。

sentences.english: A decade ago I might have attended one of Whitney’s seminars (if I could have afforded it).
sentences.chinese: 十年前我就應該參加Whitney的研討班的。

sentences.english: On the whole, average weekly hours are far below their pre-recession level.
sentences.chinese: 整體而言，周平均工作時間比起衰退前大幅下滑。

definition: of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
around/from beginning to end/all around/front and rear
to shift to an earlier date/to do sth ahead of time/in advance
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
to watch from a height or distance/to survey
